subject: Home & DIY
title: Lithium Battery Fires in Your Home
description: One-minute skill: Lithium Battery Fires in Your Home.

hook.text: Lithium-ion batteries power phones, laptops, and scooters. When they fail, they burn at 600Â°C and water won't help.

buildup.text: Thermal runaway starts when a damaged cell overheats. One cell's heat triggers the next in a chain reaction.

discovery.text: A swelling battery is the first warning. If your phone or laptop case bulges, the cell is off-gassing and may fail.

twist.text: E-bike and scooter batteries cause outsized fires due to cheap third-party chargers and larger, more energetic packs.

climax.text: Fire departments say: never charge lithium batteries overnight, use only OEM chargers, and avoid flammable surfaces.

punchline.text: The battery in your pocket can burn your house down.

quiz.question: What is the first visible warning sign of a failing lithium battery?
options: Swelling or bulging of the battery or device case
The device taking longer to charge
